title: Williamsburg Orange Butter Frosting Recipe
description: Enjoy this creamy and buttery frosting made with orange liqueur and orange zest on a Williamsburg orange cake or any cake!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Desserts Frostings and Icings Williamsburg Orange Butter Frosting 4.7 (10) 8 Reviews 4 Photos You don't have to make a Williamsburg orange cake to enjoy this creamy and buttery Williamsburg frosting made with orange liqueur and orange zest. Submitted by Carol Updated on April 8, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 4 4 Prep Time: 15 mins Total Time: 15 mins Servings: 16 Yield: 3 cups frosting Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 16 servings 4 ½ cups confectioners' sugar ½ cup butter, softened 12 teaspoons orange liqueur 1 tablespoon orange zest Directions Beat confectioners' sugar and butter together in a large bowl until well combined. Stir in orange liqueur and orange zest. Beat until light and fluffy. Use to frost a cooled cake. I Made It Print Nutrition Facts (per serving) 197 Calories 6g Fat 36g Carbs 0g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 16 Calories 197 % Daily Value * Total Fat 6g 7% Saturated Fat 4g 19% Cholesterol 15mg 5% Sodium 42mg 2% Total Carbohydrate 36g 13% Total Sugars 35g Protein 0g 0% Vitamin C 1mg 1% Calcium 3mg 0% Potassium 4mg 0% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Add Your Photo Photos of Williamsburg Orange Butter Frosting 01 of 04 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 04 Photo by  steve s 09/04/2020 03 of 04 Photo by  Khor Hui Min 07/20/2012 I used orange to replace the liqueur. The flavour of the frosting is very good. A few of the reviewers said the frosting was dry. But I have made this frosting many times already, as a filling for the Williamsburg Orange Cake (also from this website) and as a frosting for cupcakes (same cake recipe). As a filling it is great. Used as a frosting for a cake or cupcakes, I find it a bit soft. Perhaps it has to do with my hot and humid tropical climate - I live in Malaysia. But I will continue to use it because it smells and tastes great, and it's refreshingly different from the usual buttercream frosting. I just put the cake with the frosting in the fridge to set overnight before taking it anywhere. 1 You’ll Also Love Homemade Chocolate Frosting 101 Ratings Fluffy Chocolate Buttercream Frosting 5 Ratings Perfect Chocolate Buttercream Frosting 7 Ratings Coffee Butter Frosting 226 Ratings Lemon Cupcake with Blackberry Buttercream 305 Ratings Mint Buttercream Frosting With Dark Chocolate Glaze 89 Ratings Becel Buttercream Frosting Marshmallow Buttercream Frosting 145 Ratings French Chocolate Buttercream 1 Rating Brownie Cupcakes with Hazelnut Buttercream 15 Ratings One Bowl Buttercream Frosting 252 Ratings Air Fryer Mini Dark Chocolate Cake with Brown Butter Frosting French Vanilla Cake with French Vanilla Buttercream Frosting 7 Ratings Chocolate-Orange Cupcakes with Pistachio Buttercream 7 Ratings Carrot Cupcakes with White Chocolate Cream Cheese Icing 561 Ratings Chocolate Cookie Buttercream Frosting 358 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Carol
instructions: Beat confectioners' sugar and butter together in a large bowl until well combined. Stir in orange liqueur and orange zest. Beat until light and fluffy. Use to frost a cooled cake.
